alert.note: Alert for Coffey (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 09 at 5:39AM CDT until May 09 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Kansas, including the following counties, Anderson and Coffey. * WHEN...Until 845 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 539 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Garnett, New Strawn, Westphalia, Kincaid, Harris and Garnett Airport.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
